history.content: 186 is not worth to delay graduation for at all. 162 is a pretty good class, but unless you are working in low-level OS or embedded where it is absolutely mandatory, it's not required for general SWE, especially if you already have a full-time offer. The main benefit of 162 is to teach you to work in a group and prepare you for internships/jobs, but you already have a job so it's not too necessary.

children.subject: <md>if you really want to get a taste of 186 material all of the lectures are on youtube!</md>

Delaying graduation for either of these classes may not be a great idea. That said, as a SWE in industry, you absolutely need to know 162 concepts. I recommend self-learning the material in the Anderson & Dahlin textbook. 186 concepts after taking 162 are fairly straightforward, and if you find you need them for your job, you can just watch past lectures.
I would delay my graduation to avoid taking 186, I'd recommend just learning in production.

history.content:
I have a full time offer for swe starting summer 2021, intend to work as a swe after graduation, but haven't taken any swe-related upper divs. 

Given that money and enrolment isn't an issue, in what circumstances would you delay graduation by a semester (and intern over the summer) to take 162/186 before starting swe full time? What are the long term benefits career-wise of taking 162/186?
history.subject: Taking 162/186 before starting SWE full time
